credit_line: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
title: Altar
provenance: Ex collection: Piancastelli and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee.
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash
description: Vertical rectangle. Above is the elevation, below, separated by a wide dark strip the plan. Above steps stand four columns and support the half-circular entablature, above which four figures stand and a half dome rises; on top a figure with a cross. The mensa with the tabernacle stands at the back wall. Colored background. At the reverse are some colored oblongs.
name: Drawing
